str2: Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.
Probably from the base of musterion; dull or stupid, i.e. Heedless, blockhead, absurd.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the base of chraomai; gold; by extension, a golden article, as an ornament or coin.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A temple, a shrine, that part of the temple where God himself resides. From a primary naio; a fane, shrine, temple.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.
